clinical_study.brief_title: Autologous Cultured Corneal Epithelium (CECA) for the Treatment of Limbal Stem Cell Deficiency
clinical_study.official_title: Autologous Cultured Corneal Epithelium ( Culture d'épithélium cornéen Autologue CECA) for the Treatment of Unilateral Corneal Lesions Associated With Limbal Stem Cell Deficiency

lead_sponsor.agency: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Québec, CHU de Québec

clinical_study.source: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Québec, CHU de Québec

brief_summary.textblock: The study " Autologous cultured corneal epithelium (CECA) for the treatment of unilateral corneal lesions associated with limbal stem cell deficiency" is the first clinical trial of this product manufactured at the LOEX laboratory. The culture of corneal epithelium strives to produce a reconstructed tissue with the therapeutical aim of treatment of unilateral limbal stem cell deficiency (only one eye is affected by the limbal stem cell deficiency). The study is a phase I/phase II study with the goal to evaluate safety and efficacy of the CECA graft for the treatment of human patients suffering from limbal stem cell deficiency.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.description: Evaluation according to the Snellen scale

secondary_outcome.description: Slit lamp examination: coloration with Fluorescein

secondary_outcome.measure: Integrity of the surface of the epithelium

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male and female patients with limbal stem cell deficiency
Exclusion Criteria:
- Bilateral limbal stem cell deficiency
- Unilateral limbal stem cell deficiency with more than 50% of damage to the contralateral eye
- Pregnancy
- Breast-feeding
- Minors
- known allergy to aprotinine (Trasylol (R))
- Hypersensibility to bovine proteins
